snippet: Gov. Gray Davis is considering a measure passed by the California Legislature last week that would become the toughest child passenger safety law in the country. The measure would require children to ride in booster seats or harnesses until they a...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Gray Davis is considering a measure passed by the California Legislature last week that would become the toughest child passenger safety law in the country. The measure would require children to ride in booster seats or harnesses until they are 7 years old. Current law in California requires car seats for children under 4 years old and 40 pounds.
abstract: Calif Gov Gray Davis considers bill passed by Legislature that would require children to ride in booster seats or harnesses until they are seven years old (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California May Raise Age for Child Car Seats
